summary: Email chain between a U.S. Attorney's Office prosecutor and a FedEx senior paralegal regarding the identification of a FedEx records custodian to authenticate records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell for an upcoming trial. The emails discuss obtaining shipment data from 2007-2020 and preparing for potential testimony.

persons.name: Tracy Chapell
persons.context: FedEx senior paralegal corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's Office to locate records and identify a records custodian for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the upcoming trial in New York for which FedEx records are being sought.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named alongside Ghislaine Maxwell as a subject of the records search for FedEx accounts or data.

connections.description: Both are named as subjects of the records search for FedEx accounts or data, indicating their association in the investigation.
Chapell, as a FedEx paralegal, is assisting the prosecution in obtaining records relevant to Maxwell's trial.

events.title: Subpoena to FedEx by SD Florida
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida sent a subpoena to FedEx in February 2008.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Scheduled
events.description: Trial for Ghislaine Maxwell scheduled to start in New York in November 2021.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was seeking a FedEx records custodian to authenticate records for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
FedEx shipment data from 2007 to 2020 was being reviewed for accounts associated with Jeffrey Epstein or Ghislaine Maxwell.
A previous subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida was sent to FedEx in February 2008 regarding these records.
The correspondence indicates the prosecution was preparing for trial by securing witness testimony to authenticate documentary evidence.
